content.key_points:
Characteristics of a Preterm Newborn

**PRETERM Mnemonic:**

- **P** – rotective function interference
- **R** – esistance to infection is low
- **E** – limination problems
- **T** – emp. Regulation► unstable
- **E** – tiology ►placental factors, uterine factors
- **R** – espiratory difficulty
- **M** – ortality causes:
  • Pneumonia
  • Septicemia
  • Diarrhea
  • Meningitis
  • Respiratory depression

questions.question_text: Which of the following are characteristics of a premature newborn?\n\nSelect all that apply:
questions.rationale: **RATIONALE**\n\nPoor sucking ability, thin skin, and diminished bowel sounds are signs indicative of prematurity in the newborn.

extraction_metadata.notes: Complete preterm newborn concept from right side of PDF page 162. Includes PRETERM mnemonic for characteristics and mortality causes.
extraction_metadata.reference: Pillitteri, Adele. Maternal and Child Health Nursing, Philadelphia. Lippincott Williams and Wilkins
